svg.inkscape:export-filename: /Users/nahamlet@us.ibm.com/Box Sync/IBM-Watson ED K12/Pathway-Centric CONOPS/Mastery-Readiness Offering/Storyboard Graphics/181210 Curriculum-Alignment Maturity Model—Concise.png

flowRoot.flowPara: ⪧ Enacted curriculum — District-standard course blueprints with learning
⪧ Asessed curriculum — Standards-aligned evidence-of-learning history either
non-existent or sporadically collected in "minor" peer system.
⪧ Intended curriculum — District standard course blueprints with learning
⪧ Assessed curriculum — Standards-aligned evidence of learning a collected
a few times per year through accountability, other major assessments.
⪧ Intended curriculum — District blueprints, curriclum maps prescribe learning-
standard targets for learning activities, course units as well as criteria for
⪧ Rigorous, learning-standards-targeted instructional design in enacted
curriculum produces daily, calibrated, learning-standards-aligned formative
[Mislevey2012] R. J. Mislevy, R. Zwick, "Scaling, linking, and reporting in a periodic assessment system,"
Journal of Educational Measurement, Summer 2012, pp. 148 - 166.
